full_text: Elz i eo IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM 2018/KERMH6 PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE SUNIL THOMAS WEDNESDAY, THE 3RD DAY OF JANUARY 2018 / 13TH POUSHA, 1939 Cri.MC.No. 8763 of 2017 PENDING AS CP.NO.50/2017 OF JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, CHANGANACHERRY CRIME NO. 1020/2016 OF CHINGAVANAM POLICE STATION , KOTTAYAM PETITIONER(S)/2ND ACCUSED MOHANAN NAIR AGED 55 YEARS S/O. NARAYANA PILLAI PUTHOOR HOUSE, MALAKUNNAM P.O, CHANGANASSERRY BY ADVS.SRI.T.P.PRADEEP SRI.P.K.SATHEES KUMAR SRILK.RAMACHANDRAN RESPONDENT(S)/COMPLAINANTS: 4. STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR HIGH COURT OF KERALA 2. SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE CHINGAVANAM 686 531 BY SRI.ALEX M.THAMBRA, PUBLIC PROSECUTOR THIS CRIMINAL MISC, CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 03-01-2018, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: R.AV nl rapa SUNIL THOMAS, J EE Crl.M.C.No.8763 of 2017 Dated this the 3 day of January, 2018 ORDER The petitioner herein is arrayed as the second accused in Crime No.1020 of 2016 of Chingavanam Police Station for offences punishable under sections 342, 323, 324 and 302 read with section 34 of the Indian Penal Code. After investigation, final report was laid and the matter is pending as CP.No.50.2017 before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Changanasserry. The case stood posted to 23.11.2017 for the appearance of the accused. It is stated that on that day, the petitioner appeared through counsel and filed vakkalath along with an application to excuse the absence of accused. The reason stated was that he was suffering from illness. The case was adjourned to 14.12.2017 on which day also the petitioner herein was absent. The reason stated was that the petitioner had not recovered from the illness. The court below rejected the application for excusing the absence of the accused and issued non bailable warrant. nl Crl.M.C.No.8763 of 2017 2 2. The petitioner has approached this court contending that he was appearing before the court below through the counsel and was effectively represented by the counsel. However, the petitioner submits that he is ready and willing to appear before the court below and to submit himself to its jurisdiction and also to appear on all future posting dates personally or through the counsel. The only anxiety of the petitioner herein is that since non bailable warrant has been issued, he is likely to be remanded. 3. Having considered the fact that the petitioner herein was effectively represented through the counsel on both the occasion, I am inclined to permit the petitioner herein to surrender before the court below within a period of ten days from today. If he so appears and files application for recalling the warrant, the application shall be taken up by the court below on the same day itself and shall pass appropriate orders in accordance with law. The warrant issued by the court below will be kept in Eur Bien 2018/KER/46 Crl.M.C.No.8763 of 2017 3 abeyance till the date of his appearance within the above ten days. Crl.M.C is disposed of as above. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS, JUDGE R.AV //True Copy// PA to Judge
